text:
For those building analysis platforms for the emergency:

Data Inventory and CODs | HumanitarianResponse
<https://www.humanitarianresponse.info/en/applications/tools/toolbox-item/data-inventory-and-cods|https://www.humanitarianresponse.info/en/applications/tools/toolbox-item/data-inventory-and-cods>


Common Operational Datasets

See also the COD/FOD Registry.
The most critical datasets to be identified, cleaned, and shared with the humanitarian community are the common and fundamental operational datasets (CODs/FODs). The Inter-Agency Standing Committee (IASC) has outlined the CODs/FODs needed in disaster preparedness and response:

CODs are predictable, core sets of data needed to support operations and decision-making for all actors in a humanitarian response. 
FODs are datasets required to support multiple cluster/sector operations and complement the common operational datasets. These datasets are characterized by thematic areas such as education or health facilities, or other operationally relevant datasets such as security incidents, damage assessments, etc.

The most critical datasets to be identified, cleaned, and shared with the humanitarian community are the common and fundamental operational datasets (CODs/FODs). The Inter-Agency Standing Committee (IASC) has outlined the CODs/FODs needed in disaster preparedness and response:

CODs are predictable, core sets of data needed to support operations and decision-making for all actors in a humanitarian response. 
FODs are datasets required to support multiple cluster/sector operations and complement the common operational datasets. These datasets are characterized by thematic areas such as education or health facilities, or other operationally relevant datasets such as security incidents, damage assessments, etc.

text: Hi everyone! I'm working with a group of Harvard data analytics students on a project with the IMF to construct a high frequency leading indicator index of economic activity for Sub-Saharan Africa. We are currently focused on the largest 10 economies, including Ethiopia. *Looking for any leads on real-time (or weekly) data that could help build a nowcast for economic activity, p*articularly interested in datasets for country-level mobile payments, trade/capital flows, satellite imagery, air quality, electricity usage, etc. Thanks in advance for your help!

elements.text: Hi everyone! I'm working with a group of Harvard data analytics students on a project with the IMF to construct a high frequency leading indicator index of economic activity for Sub-Saharan Africa. We are currently focused on the largest 10 economies, including Ethiopia.
Looking for any leads on real-time (or weekly) data that could help build a nowcast for economic activity, p
articularly interested in datasets for country-level mobile payments, trade/capital flows, satellite imagery, air quality, electricity usage, etc. Thanks in advance for your help!
